reviews.review: Вот это игра,вот это сюжет и окончание историй Биошока,игру прошёл с большим восторгом,после прохождения так и хочеться заново вернуться и перепройти,да Биошок один из крутых шутеров на сей день,игра проходиться на одном дыхание,геймплей просто шикарный,одним слово в эту игру та вообще в серию Биошок должен поиграть каждый!)

An Exquisite game

This is the first game in a very long time that I have sat and played from start to finish, downloaded the DLC and then played that from start to finish and then restarted the main game again for another playthrough, all in the matter of a couple of days.

best game I have played in a very long time with a trully epic story with more "HOLY SHIT" moments than I can remember. I would absolutely suggest after playing the main game through, play the Burial at sea DLC as it will make so many things a lot clearer in the main story.

This has been the best purchase in the 2015 summer sale in my honest opinion.

Its Real Bad

Maybe because I'm coming from W3 and bought this game on sale (meaning: Older), but I am completely dissapointed in where my money went. One of the big complaints of Witcher 3 is the re-use of NPC assets, but compaired to this game, that world is a metropolis. before your first bullet is fired you will see 3 people in Eden (not counting the 2 in the boat you can't quite see or know). Now, you'll see like 50 different NPC's, but they are 2 different guys and a girl. This is some world of clones. Knowing that the storyline will be full of 'characters' forced me to ignore it and get on with it, but the polygon level in this game...is low. For sure. The strange draw to this game for me was the amazing reviews and the fact that it's still  used in a benchmark for modern computers, but having played it, I don't know why. The story isn't benchmarked, so why is such a low fidelity game used in CPU and GPU comparisons?
I really loved the game it runned smooth and just overall great love bioshock

buen juego! el final solo trata de ser super ESPECTACULAR sin realmente dar a entender las cosas como para que te quedes asi como ''WOOOOOOOOOOOOW increible'' y no es asi... esta bien, pero me dio la sensacion de que fue un final muy forzado solo para que te quede esa falsa sensacion de espectacular. mas allá de eso el juego es super entretenido, muy bueno en todos los aspectos y merece la pena comprarlo. definitivamente un shooter con buena historia!

Узнал об этой игре, очень хотел поиграть, но старый комп не тянул, когда забыл об этой игре, решил купить
Нафиг истории, теперь к делу: 
1.Сюжет: Сюжет этой игры просто шикарнейший, очень мало игр с таким сюжетом, я рыдал как сучка когда прошел игру.
2.Графика: великолепна, часть души графодрочера просто ликовала!
3.Оптимизация: хорошая, иногда на ультра бывает проседания на 1-2 кадра, но это не важно
4.Персонажи: Персонажи сделаны просто великолепно, стимпанк, смешаный с эпохой начала 90-х, великолепные главные герои, меня больше всего впечатлила (скорее всего всех) Элизабет, она просто....это не описать словами, она великолепна!!!
Моя оценка: 10/10

Bioshock Infinite has a beautifully crafted world which is extremely immersive and captivating.
The storyline is absolutely gorgeous and refined to perfection and is one of the single best stories I have ever seen in gaming, it's just a shame that the gameplay could not live up.  The gameplay is a little dull and repetitive and the bosses lackluster and irritating (fucking ghost boss).  Overall though this game is definitely worth it due to the significance of the story and it's on sale all the time!  BUY IT
Easily the best first person FPS storyline I've ever played. A lot of really intriguing themes are dealt with in a great storyline and a killer ending. 10/10 would play again.
Don't play this as a shooter but just enjoy the colourfull story as it moves you allong... creative and artful... and the ending... wow!!! never has a game left me speechless... well done guys!

BioShock Infinite is one of my favorite games of all time. I saw a let's play of it and decided to purchase it for myself. Now when I first got it and started playing it...I may have played it for 6 hours straight and then the following day finished the remaining 6 hours straight. 

The guns were really fun to  mess with especially. My favorites are the Carbine and Shotgun. When you properly upgrade the shotgun you can run straight into enemies and blow them to kingdom come and it feels reeeeeally satisfying. One of the other things I like about the game is the crazy amount of stuff/easter eggs you can find while you play the game. It will leave you wanting to play the game more than once because you'll want to find everything there is and hear every Voxophone. (Am I the only person that absolutely loves how they sound? The old-timey static sound?)

But yeah. Explosions, guns, insanity, rage while containing an existential crisis. My favorite kind of game.

If you are a Bioshock fan and were let down by Bioshock 2, this will make up for it. The game dilivers what we expect and a little bit more. 9/10. Get this game. Worth the time you put in.

I picked up BioShock Infinite and all its DLCs on a sale. I noticed it received good reviews and I really enjoyed the original so I thought it was a no-brainer. This game does not attempt to create the amazing atmosphere from BioShock. The moral dilemma of harvesting children is gone. Instead, Infinite is an extremely linear shooter void of any character development that relies on a "twist" at the end to redeem itself. I fails in my opinion. The gameplay was a big downer for me. The Elizabeth character is AWFUL. I wanted to kill her myself. The developers built in a system where she randomly finds money and ammo and gives it to the player. It is done through a cut scene and cannot be avoided if you accept the item. This is so incredibly annoying. I the middle of a fire fight, you accept ammo from Elizabeth and end up getting shot all to hell while the cut scene plays out. Her dialogue is also grating. Every time you direct her to pick a lock she gives one of a few smart ass replies. "No problem" or "Give me a real challenge" are examples. Having to hear the same trite dialogue with every lock pick made me not want to use her at all. I found this game disappointing and would not recommend it to others.

Вот спустя год прошёл её во второй раз. Честно говоря, пожалел, но пожалел не потому что игра туфта, а потому что сюжет в ней на столько шикарен, что я теперь снова залипаю сижу, как и год назад. Это как шикарный фильм посмотреть и жалеть о том, что ты его уже посмотрел и очередной такой же шедевр ты вряд ли увидишь.
Плевать на сюжет и геймплей (хоть и они на все 10 баллов). Сюжет и музыка сделают свое дело. Можно даже пройти её на легком уровне, за пол дня, но узнать весь сюжет этой игры должен абсолютно каждый! Не прошёл этот биошок - жизнь прожил зря.
Обожаю Элизабет, обожаю Букера, обожаю Лютесов.
Игра навсегда останется в моем сердце.
Десяточка, хотя стоп.. соточка.. в прочем, игра неоценима. Берите, не пожалеете.

Wer schon einmal einen Teil der BioShock-Reihe gespielt hat, kommt mit dem Gameplay von Infinite ziemlich schnell zurecht. Neben den normalen Handfeuerwaffen bekommt unser Held Booker DeWitt zusätzlich einige magische Fähigkeiten spendiert, welche an die Plasmide aus Rapture erinnern. Dieses Mal verschlägt es den Spieler aber nicht in die Tiefen des Meeres, sondern nach oben in die Wolkenstadt Columbia. Diese strotzt nur so vor liebevollen Details und versteckten Objekten, die es einzusammeln gilt. 

Der Anfang des Spiels ist wesentlich gemächlicher als in BioShock oder BioShock 2. Man wird behutsam an die Welt und ihre Bewohner herangeführt, bevor man sich in die Action stürzt. Der Grund für Bookers Anreise ist dabei ursprünglich recht simpel: Ein Mädchen finden und es aus der Stadt bringen. Mehr möchte ich zur grandiosen Story des Spiels gar nicht sagen.

Die Technik von BioShock Infinte überzeugt voll und ganz. Die verschiedenen Schauplätze sind allesamt hübsch gestaltet und vor allem die Beleuchtung des Spiels kann sich sehen lassen. Diese wird nur noch durch den absolut großartigen Sound übertroffen. Von den Gesprächen der Bewohner am Rand der Straße bis hin zu der musikalischen Untermalung passt einfach alles. 

BioShock Infinite sollte jeder mal gespielt haben. Viel mehr braucht man eigentlich nicht sagen.

As someone who doesn't really prefer traditional first person shooters, I was iffy about this game from the very beginning. Many times I wanted to decide to just watch a playthrough of it on YouTube, because I wanted to experience the story without having to deal with the gameplay. But I held off on that as well. I made up my mind during the Steam summer sale and finished it within about 10 hours.

It goes without saying at this point that the story of this game is masterfully crafted and really throws your mind for a loop. I wasn't smart enough to understand everything right away, but after some deep digging on the interwebz, and some help from a good friend of mine who's played the game multiple times, I started to make sense of things and was completely in awe. I also like how the game pulled an Inception TWICE at the end, before and after the credits, leaving things open-ended. Really gets you thinking.

The gameplay was the one thing that made me iffy with this game in the first place. I like first person games, but not traditional shooters. Give me a game like Mirror's Edge, Skyrim and Dishonored and I would have no qualms with it. But if it's a full-on SHOOTER, that'll give me some doubts. However, I did find myself having SOME fun with it, surprisingly. Although I will say that the gameplay does get in the way of the story most of the time. The combat and battles were just...there, for no particular reason other than to remind me that I'm playing a video game.

At the end of the day, the story outshines the gameplay by a longshot. If you were in a discussion where everyone was pumped up and discussing the game, they would only talk about the story. If someone said "How about that gameplay, though?", there would be awkward silence and shrugs before they continue discussing the plot again.

I suppose I'm just not very happy with how this game seemed split about wanting to be a narrative-focused shooter or a shooter than happens to have an amazing plot. I wish they had made this game an RPG perhaps, and allowed us to interact more with the environment, and also minimized the combat elements which felt very phoned-in to me and definitely immersion-breaking.

I have nothing bad to say about the story whatsoever, but the gameplay does feel lackluster to me. Regardless, I still enjoyed myself for the most part. But a huge chunk of that enjoyment mostly came from simply exploring around and finding the various audio recordings and secrets in the game that give some interesting insight to the world of it. I felt pretty indifferent about the combat, and I played on the easiest difficulty since the biggest reason I avoid shooters is that I can't play them worth sh*t.

I may dislike FPS games but I don't HATE them, so I was still able to push through. However, if you're someone who DOES hate FPS games, then I would suggest watching a playthrough of it so you can experience the story without having to deal with the gameplay.

Funciona bien en Linux, aunque hay que modificar el lanzador para que el juego no sufra cuelgues (en los foros hay información al respecto). Parece un juego nativo, a pesar de estar con un wrapper. Con tarjetas sencillas (yo estoy con una humilde Geforce GT730 de 2 GB) se puede jugar con detalles medios en HD sin problemas.

BioShock Infinite is a timey-wimey dystopian genre game where you play as Booker DeWitt trying to rescue the girl from a city in the sky and keep her from the evil ruler of said city. This game has a 5-star story and the graphics are fantastic, too. It's easy to play and if you are looking to get lost in another world, Infinite is for you. If you are into steampunk and dystopian games, then this is a great choice for you. It's no wonder this game has Overwhelmingly Positive written throughout the reviews.

Would definitely play again and recommend it to others.
